sen.j: 有栖川宮職仁親王（ありすがわのみやよりひとしんのう 正徳 3年9月10日 （1713年10月28日） - 明和6年10月22日 （1769年11月19日））は江戸時代の皇族。
sen.e: Arisugawanomiya Imperial Prince Yorihito (October 28, 1713 - November 19, 1769) was the Imperial family during the Edo period.
Arisugawanomiya Imperial Prince Yorihito (October 28, 1713 - November 19, 1769) was a member of the Imperial family during the Edo period.
Imperial Prince Arisugawanomiya Yorihito (October 28, 1713 - November 19, 1769) was a member of the Imperial family during the Edo period.
The fifth family head of the Asisugawa family
The fifth family head of the Arisugawa family
The fifth family head of the Arisugawanomiya family.
sen.cmt: 有栖川宮→the Arisugawanomiya familyに訂正しました。ピリオド補足。

sen.e: The seventieth Prince of Emperor Reigen
The 17th Prince of Emperor Reigen
The 17th Prince of Emperor Reigen
His Empress was Yoshitada NIJO's daughter.
His Empress was Yoshitada NIJO's daughter.
His Empress was Yoshitada NIJO's daughter.

sen.j: 子に有栖川宮織仁親王。
sen.e: His child was Arisugawanomiya Imperial Prince Orihito.
His child was Arisugawanomiya Imperial Prince Orihito.
His child was Imperial Prince Arisugawanomiya Orihito.

sen.j: 享保元年（1716年）に、有栖川宮の第4代当主有栖川宮正仁親王が嗣子なく没したため、有栖川宮を相続した。
sen.e: He succeeded to the family after the forth family head of the Arisugawanomiya, Arisugawanomiya Imperial Prince Tadahito died without having any children.
He succeeded to the family after the forth family head of the Arisugawanomiya, Arisugawanomiya Imperial Prince Tadahito died without having any children.
He succeeded to the family after the forth family head of the Arisugawanomiya, Imperial Prince Arisugawanomiya Tadahito died without having any children in 1716.
He received to title to become Imperial Prince in 1726.
He received title to become Imperial Prince in 1726.
He received title to become Imperial Prince in 1726.

sen.j: いわゆる有栖川流書道を創始した。
sen.e: He established what it was called the Arisugawa school of calligraphy.
He established what was called the Arisugawa school of calligraphy.
He established what was called the Arisugawa school of calligraphy.

sen.j: 和歌や書道に造詣が深く、後桜町天皇などに歌道を伝授した。
sen.e: He had deep knowledge of waka poems and calligraphy, he taught the art of tanka poetry to people such as Emperor Gosakuramachi.
He had deep knowledge of waka poems and calligraphy, he taught the art of tanka poetry to people such as Emperor Gosakuramachi.
He had deep knowledge of waka poems and calligraphy, he taught the art of tanka poetry to people such as Emperor Gosakuramachi.
